Regardless of the fact that you will probably not read this comment (because of the thousands you receive every day) I just wanted to thank you for making me realise and bring up a lost skill. Back in the day (2 years ago) when I was in Year 7 (I´m spanish by the way I just go to a British school in Spain) I thought I was rubbish at math. However I did have a devotion for Physics, a topic which I loved then and I still to this day. Anyway, Khan Academy made me think of maths in the same way I thought of physics making me much better than I thought I would be. This year I got "promoted" to year 10 (by age I should be doing year 9) something which made me happy and brought a few problems to my mind.
Despite being the youngest, Khan Academy makes me more confident and I now think of maths as a free time hobby more than an obligatory pain in my head. Strange though it may be, I always had that passion for Physics, something that now has been succesfully applicated to maths. How can something free create a so expensive change in you.
Thanks Sal Khan and the whole Khan Academy team.
Javier
Like everyone has been making a point of saying, you don't need to thank us, we need to thank you :3 without your guys help I think I would've failed maths last year!

I did my BE many years ago. My son was doing his foundation last year. I helped him with his Maths, Physics, Chemistry and Biology. Either my memory has failed me or their subject/depth now are new or deeper, I could not do some of the exercises. So I turned to my tutor on the net - Khan Academy! Good to learn or refresh my memory.

Many many thanks! Hope to see more and better programs years ahead!

Happy New Year to all in Khan Academy!

I donated because KhanAcademy taught me that I CAN learn math, after failing miserably at math during my first 49 or so years of life with undiagnosed ADHD. KhanAcademy doesn't go on to the next skill until users MASTER a skill, and KhanAcademy never gives up - It teaches me repeatedly in various ways until it finally clicks! An in-person tutor would become very frustrated with me. I'm still not a math genius, but it greatly reduced my phobia & anxiety about math. Also, because I could finally have a positive attitude about math, I was able to be more encouraging to my sons about math. Even just 30 minutes a day will help anyone.

I donated on 1-31-2016 through Paypal & PayPal said it would add 1% to my donation. I hope that even donations through PayPal were matched by the anonymous giver you mentioned in your email.

Congratulations on exceeding the goal for 2016!! If I can say a sort of weird thing casually, I kind of associate your voice with learning/explanations/fun studying/good grades now? Which really says a lot about my experience with Khan Academy; it really saved my grades in chemistry and math, and I got a 1530 in the SAT for which I only used your site to prepare. I even did the Hour of Code once, something I never even knew about before. And I'm so glad you're adding world history at last (I NEED history... namely the French revolution and 20th century Russia and the Italian and German unifications and the World Wars) and grammar (to help me perfect anything I don't already know) and things like that? If you could add a sociology category, or a psychology category, or a literature category, that would be GREAT!!!

No thank you Sal. I remember when it was primarily math and you were my replacement for the UI Campaign Ill PLATO program. Here at SAC I could get students through the CIS curriculum but to get an AAS they needed, they had to pass College Algebra, which was not easy and in some cases almost impossible. The PLATO math on-line was my savior until the college quit funding it. Finding the KHAN academy was my saving grace. The beauty was I could tell everyone about the KHAN academy, it was available to everyone :-).

I've retired and now only do an on-line class for the College but the number of people I come in contact with who are looking for good on-line math education is increasing. Now you even have CS and other areas and I'm getting hugs from lots of parents and students for all the KHAN academy does for EVERYONE. Thank You Thank You!!

My goodness, but who would vote a thumbs down on a "Thank You" video?  Mr. Khan is expressing his appreciation to those of us who support the Khan Academy and that deserves nothing less than a thumbs up!  Thanks, Mr. Khan for caring about the state of education in this country; if you'd been around when I was young my whole life might have turned out differently, and by that I mean BETTER!

Mr. Khan let me join in in thanking you for taking the time, effort, and passion you've shown over the years in developing the future of learning free for everyone. Keep up the great work, and I'll keep referring everyone I know that needs a little help, refreshment, or tutoring in too many subjects to list to your wonderful website and app. Thanks again.

Contributing to the success of Khan Academy is not an option for us. We use it for all our kids, and it completely enriches their education. I use it constantly, myself, simply for the joy of learning.

Thank you Sal. In one of your earlier videos, you mention how many people lack foundational learning. You make the point that many fail as they progress through the grades because of the lack of that foundation. I agree. Our current educational system is broken. It is geared to pump out waves of students not taking the time to develop each to their fullest potential. It's a terrible waste of human talent. I believe that Kahn Academy sets forth a model for the future of education. Your genius and the skills of your team make KA one of the most important models for the future of mankind.

No.....THANK YOU, Sal. thank you for providing free, interesting , fun, and easy to understand high quality tutorials. I am an older student who went to university 10 years after getting my GED when I was 17 after nearly dropping out of high school. So when I decided I wanted to get a doctorate of sciences in biology ......I had to learn a lot of higher math in very very short time on my own. I had to enroll in College Algebra having only taken up to Pre-Algebra a decade ago. I didn't even know how to do square roots when I went back but now I that I am at the level required ....I love math so much that I am still learning higher math as a hobby on my own.

If it were not for Khan Academy I would've never been able to learn AND keep up enough with the class to pass. After 3 semesters of very very hard work I now have a working knowledge of math up to a Calculus level....as well as a solid understanding of data analysis and statistical testing for everyday application in the lab......and I never went to a tutor even once. I could not have done it if Khan Academy did not exist for free and available 24 hrs a day anytime anywhere.

I am very poor and cannot afford to donate now......but when I get my doctorate, I will be donating yearly.
